intro: Hyaenanche, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinctive botanical feature. The plants typically have opposite leaves and produce showy, often tubular flowers in various colors. Hyaenanche species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Some species are used in traditional medicine, highlighting their ecological and cultural significance.
